info.title: Deribit API - Account Management
info.description: Deribit API specification for Account Management endpoints

get.description: Retrieve user positions. To retrieve subaccount positions, use `subaccount_id` parameter.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Kind filter on positions

parameters.name: subaccount_id
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount

get.description: Retrieve user position.

parameters.name: instrument_name
parameters.description: Instrument name

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency symbol

parameters.name: subaccount_id
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount
Include additional fields
parameters.name: extended

get.description: Retrieves user account summary. To read subaccount summary use `subaccount_id` parameter.

parameters.name: subaccount_id
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount
Include additional fields
parameters.name: extended

get.description: Retrieves a per-currency list of user account summaries. To read subaccount summary use `subaccount_id` parameter.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency for which the Extended Risk Matrix will be calculated. Use `CROSS` for Cross Collateral simulation.

parameters.name: add_positions
parameters.description: If `true`, adds simulated positions to current positions, otherwise uses only simulated positions. By default `true`

parameters.name: simulated_positions
parameters.description: Object with positions in following form: `{InstrumentName1: Position1, InstrumentName2: Position2...}`, for example `{"BTC-PERPETUAL": -1.0}` (or corresponding URI-encoding for GET). Size in base currency.

get.description: Calculates the Extended Risk Matrix and margin information for the selected currency or against the entire Cross-Collateral portfolio.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency symbol

parameters.name: add_positions
parameters.description: If `true`, adds simulated positions to current positions, otherwise uses only simulated positions. By default `true`

parameters.name: simulated_positions
parameters.description: Object with positions in following form: `{InstrumentName1: Position1, InstrumentName2: Position2...}`, for example `{"BTC-PERPETUAL": -1000.0}` (or corresponding URI-encoding for GET). For futures in USD, for options in base currency.

get.description: Calculates portfolio margin info for simulated position or current position of the user. This request has a special restricted rate limit (not more than once per a second).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination, default - `0`

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of requested items, default - `10`, maximum - `1000`

get.description: Lists access logs for the user
Retrieves user`s affiliates count, payouts and link.
Enables affiliate program for user **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Affiliate Program](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944777728797-Affiliate-Program)

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Id of a (sub)account - by default current user id is used

parameters.name: margin_model
parameters.description: Margin model

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: If `true` request returns the result without switching the margining model. Default: `false`

get.description: Change margin model
Retrieves information about locks on user account

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Self trading prevention behavior: `reject_taker` (reject the incoming order), `cancel_maker` (cancel the matched order in the book)

parameters.name: extended_to_subaccounts
parameters.description: If value is `true` trading is prevented between subaccounts of given account, otherwise they are treated separately

parameters.name: block_rfq_self_match_prevention
parameters.description: When Block RFQ Self Match Prevention is enabled, it ensures that RFQs cannot be executed between accounts that belong to the same legal entity. This setting is independent of the general self-match prevention settings and must be configured separately.

get.description: Configure self trading behavior **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Account settings page](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944634289693-Account-settings-page#heading-4)

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Id of a (sub)account

parameters.name: trading_products
parameters.description: List of available trading products. Available products: perpetual, futures, options, future_combos, option_combos, spots

get.description: Configure disabled trading products for subaccounts. Only main accounts can modify this for subaccounts. **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

get.description: Disables api key with given id. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

get.description: Enables api key with given id. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys).

parameters.name: max_scope
parameters.description: Describes maximal access for tokens generated with given key, possible values: `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_trade:[read, read_write, none]`. If scope is not provided, its value is set as none. Please check details described in [Access scope](#access-scope)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of key (only letters, numbers and underscores allowed; maximum length - 16 characters)

parameters.name: public_key
parameters.description: ED25519 or RSA PEM Encoded public key that should be used to create asymmetric API Key for signing requests/authentication requests with user's private key. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Asymmetric API keys](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944616699165-Asymmetric-API-keys)

parameters.name: enabled_features
parameters.description: List of enabled advanced on-key features. Available options: - `restricted_block_trades`: Limit the block_trade read the scope of the API key to block trades that have been made using this specific API key - `block_trade_approval`: Block trades created using this API key require additional user approval. Methods that use `block_rfq` scope are not affected by Block Trade approval feature

get.description: Creates a new api key with a given scope. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys) **[TFA required](#security-keys)** **Note:** You can display the created API key using the [private/list_api_keys](https://docs.deribit.com/#private-list_api_keys) method. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Creating new API key on Deribit](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/26268257333661-Creating-new-API-key-on-Deribit)

parameters.name: max_scope
parameters.description: Describes maximal access for tokens generated with given key, possible values: `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_trade:[read, read_write, none]`. If scope is not provided, its value is set as none. Please check details described in [Access scope](#access-scope)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

get.description: Changes scope for key with given id. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys). **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of key (only letters, numbers and underscores allowed; maximum length - 16 characters)

get.description: Changes name for key with given id. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys).
Retrieves list of api keys. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys). **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

get.description: Resets secret in api key. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

get.description: Removes api key. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of key

parameters.name: max_scope
parameters.description: Describes maximal access for tokens generated with given key, possible values: `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_trade:[read, read_write, none]`. If scope is not provided, its value is set as none. Please check details described in [Access scope](#access-scope)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of key (only letters, numbers and underscores allowed; maximum length - 16 characters)

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Enables/disables the API key. `true` to enable, `false` to disable

parameters.name: enabled_features
parameters.description: List of enabled advanced on-key features. Available options: - `restricted_block_trades`: Limit the block_trade read the scope of the API key to block trades that have been made using this specific API key - `block_trade_approval`: Block trades created using this API key require additional user approval. Methods that use `block_rfq` scope are not affected by Block Trade approval feature

parameters.name: ip_whitelist
parameters.description: Whitelist provided IP address on a selected key

get.description: Edits existing API key. At least one parameter is required. [Important notes](#creating-editing-removing-api-keys) **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: The most recent timestamp to return the results for (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum count of returned announcements, default - `5`, maximum - `50`

result.title: Example announcement
result.body: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

get.description: Retrieves announcements. Default "start_timestamp" parameter value is current timestamp, "count" parameter value must be between 1 and 50, default is 5.

result.title: Example announcement
result.body: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

get.description: Retrieves announcements that have not been marked read by the user.

parameters.description: the ID of the announcement
parameters.name: announcement_id

get.description: Marks an announcement as read, so it will not be shown in `get_new_announcements`.
Retrieves the language to be used for emails.
Create a new subaccount **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Subaccounts](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944616386973-Subaccounts)
Change the user name for a subaccount

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new user name
The abbreviated language name. Valid values include `"en"`, `"ko"`, `"zh"`, `"ja"`, `"ru"`
parameters.name: language

get.description: Changes the language to be used for emails.
Assign an email address to a subaccount. User will receive an email with a confirmation link. **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address for the subaccount

get.description: Enable or disable login for a subaccount. If login is disabled and a session for the subaccount exists, this session will be terminated. **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: enable or disable login.

get.description: Enable or disable sending of notifications for the subaccount. **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: enable (`true`) or disable (`false`) notifications

get.description: Get information about subaccounts. When called from subaccount, the response will include limited details for the main account and details for the subaccount initiating the request. The portfolio information will be included in the response only if the `with_portfolio` parameter is set to `true`.

parameters.name: with_portfolio
parameters.description: Portfolio flag: `true` for portfolio information, `false` for subaccount information only. `false` by default

get.description: Get subaccounts positions

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency symbol

parameters.name: with_open_orders
parameters.description: Optional parameter to ask for open orders list, default: `false`

get.description: Remove empty subaccount. **[TFA required](#security-keys)**

parameters.name: subaccount_id
parameters.description: The user id for the subaccount

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency symbol

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: The earliest timestamp to return result from (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: The most recent timestamp to return result from (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The following keywords can be used to filter the results: `trade`, `maker`, `taker`, `open`, `close`, `liquidation`, `buy`, `sell`, `withdrawal`, `delivery`, `settlement`, `deposit`, `transfer`, `option`, `future`, `correction`, `block_trade`, `swap`. Plus withdrawal or transfer addresses

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Count of transaction log entries returned, default - `100`, maximum - `250`

parameters.name: subaccount_id
parameters.description: Id of a subaccount

parameters.name: continuation
parameters.description: Continuation token for pagination

get.description: Retrieve the latest user trades that have occurred for a specific instrument and within a given time range. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Transaction log](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944587269021-Transaction-log)

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency symbol

get.description: Retrieves user custody accounts list. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Custody Options](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/26533163120413-Custody-Options)

timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

currency_with_any.description: Currency name or `"any"` if don't care

max_scope.description: Describes maximal access for tokens generated with given key, possible values: `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_rfq:[read, read_write, none]`. If scope is not provided, its value is set as none. Please check details described in [Access scope](#access-scope)

pme_currency.description: The currency for which the Extended Risk Matrix will be calculated. Use `CROSS` for Cross Collateral simulation.

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request

available_funds.description: The account's available funds. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

available_withdrawal_funds.description: The account's available to withdrawal funds

margin_balance.description: The account's margin balance. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

spot_reserve.description: The account's balance reserved in active spot orders

fee_group.description: Fee group indicates the level of fee discounts applied to an account. Use `extended`: `true` to view this field. If the field is missing, the account is not assigned to any fee group. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Automatically applied volume based fee discounts](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944746248989-Fees#heading-11)

deposit_address.description: The deposit address for the account (if available)

futures_session_rpl.description: Futures session realized profit and Loss

futures_session_upl.description: Futures session unrealized profit and Loss

initial_margin.description: The account's initial margin. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

maintenance_margin.description: The maintenance margin. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

system_name.description: System generated user nickname (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

options_session_rpl.description: Options session realized profit and Loss

options_session_upl.description: Options session unrealized profit and Loss

options_gamma_map.description: Map of options' gammas per index

options_theta_map.description: Map of options' thetas per index

options_vega_map.description: Map of options' vegas per index

security_keys_enabled.description: Whether Security Key authentication is enabled (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

mmp_enabled.description: Whether MMP is enabled (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

username.description: Account name (given by user) (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

login_enabled.description: Whether account is loginable using email and password (available when parameter `extended` = `true` and account is a subaccount)

id.description: Account id (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

portfolio_margining_enabled.description: `true` when portfolio margining is enabled for user

cross_collateral_enabled.description: When `true` cross collateral is enabled for user

margin_model.description: Name of user's currently enabled margin model

total_equity_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total equity in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_initial_margin_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total initial margin in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_maintenance_margin_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total maintenance margin in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_margin_balance_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total margin balance in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_delta_total_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total delta total in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

interuser_transfers_enabled.description: `true` when the inter-user transfers are enabled for user (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

referrer_id.description: Optional identifier of the referrer (of the affiliation program, and available when parameter `extended` = `true`), which link was used by this account at registration. It coincides with suffix of the affiliation link path after `/reg-`

creation_timestamp.description: Time at which the account was created (milliseconds since the Unix epoch; available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

has_non_block_chain_equity.description: Optional field returned with value `true` when user has non block chain equity that is excluded from proof of reserve calculations

self_trading_reject_mode.description: Self trading rejection behavior - `reject_taker` or `cancel_maker` (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

self_trading_extended_to_subaccounts.description: `true` if self trading rejection behavior is applied to trades between subaccounts (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

fees.description: List of fee objects for all currency pairs and instrument types related to the currency (available when parameter `extended` = `true` and user has any discounts)

kind.description: Type of the instruments the fee applies to - `future` for future instruments (excluding perpetual), `perpetual` for future perpetual instruments, `option` for options

index_name.description: The currency pair this fee applies to

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request

login_enabled.description: Informs whether login to the subaccount is enabled

is_password.description: `true` when password for the subaccount has been configured

receive_notifications.description: When `true` - receive all notification emails on the main email

security_keys_enabled.description: Whether the Security Keys authentication is enabled

id.description: Subaccount identifier
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
Account/Subaccount identifier

not_confirmed_email.description: New email address that has not yet been confirmed. This field is only included if `with_portfolio` == `true`.

security_keys_enabled.description: Whether the Security Keys authentication is enabled

security_keys_assignments.description: Names of assignments with Security Keys assigned

receive_notifications.description: When `true` - receive all notification emails on the main email

is_password.description: `true` when password for the subaccount has been configured

proof_id.description: hashed identifier used in the Proof Of Liability for the subaccount. This identifier allows you to find your entries in the Deribit Proof-Of-Reserves files. IMPORTANT: Keep it secret to not disclose your entries in the Proof-Of-Reserves.

proof_id_signature.description: signature used as a base string for proof_id hash. IMPORTANT: Keep it secret to not disclose your entries in the Proof-Of-Reserves.

login_enabled.description: Informs whether login to the subaccount is enabled

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
Account id (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

system_name.description: System generated user nickname (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

username.description: Account name (given by user) (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

login_enabled.description: Whether account is loginable using email and password (available when parameter `extended` = `true` and account is a subaccount)

security_keys_enabled.description: Whether Security Key authentication is enabled (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

mmp_enabled.description: Whether MMP is enabled (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

interuser_transfers_enabled.description: `true` when the inter-user transfers are enabled for user (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

referrer_id.description: Optional identifier of the referrer (of the affiliation program, and available when parameter `extended` = `true`), which link was used by this account at registration. It coincides with suffix of the affiliation link path after `/reg-`

creation_timestamp.description: Time at which the account was created (milliseconds since the Unix epoch; available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

self_trading_reject_mode.description: Self trading rejection behavior - `reject_taker` or `cancel_maker` (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

self_trading_extended_to_subaccounts.description: `true` if self trading rejection behavior is applied to trades between subaccounts (available when parameter `extended` = `true`)

block_rfq_self_match_prevention.description: When Block RFQ Self Match Prevention is enabled, it ensures that RFQs cannot be executed between accounts that belong to the same legal entity. This setting is independent of the general self-match prevention settings and must be configured separately.

summaries.description: Aggregated list of per-currency account summaries

available_funds.description: The account's available funds. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

available_withdrawal_funds.description: The account's available to withdrawal funds

margin_balance.description: The account's margin balance. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

spot_reserve.description: The account's balance reserved in active spot orders

fee_group.description: Fee group indicates the level of fee discounts applied to an account. Use `extended`: `true` to view this field. If the field is missing, the account is not assigned to any fee group. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Automatically applied volume based fee discounts](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944746248989-Fees#heading-11)

deposit_address.description: The deposit address for the account (if available)

futures_session_rpl.description: Futures session realized profit and Loss

futures_session_upl.description: Futures session unrealized profit and Loss

initial_margin.description: The account's initial margin. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

maintenance_margin.description: The maintenance margin. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

options_session_rpl.description: Options session realized profit and Loss

options_session_upl.description: Options session unrealized profit and Loss

options_gamma_map.description: Map of options' gammas per index

options_theta_map.description: Map of options' thetas per index

options_vega_map.description: Map of options' vegas per index

portfolio_margining_enabled.description: `true` when portfolio margining is enabled for user

cross_collateral_enabled.description: When `true` cross collateral is enabled for user

margin_model.description: Name of user's currently enabled margin model

total_equity_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total equity in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_initial_margin_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total initial margin in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_maintenance_margin_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total maintenance margin in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_margin_balance_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total margin balance in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

total_delta_total_usd.description: Optional (only for users using cross margin). The account's total delta total in all cross collateral currencies, expressed in USD

has_non_block_chain_equity.description: Optional field returned with value `true` when user has non block chain equity that is excluded from proof of reserve calculations

fees.description: List of fee objects for all currency pairs and instrument types related to the currency (available when parameter `extended` = `true` and user has any discounts)

index_name.description: The currency pair this fee applies to

id.description: The id that was sent in the request

result.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success

id.description: The id that was sent in the request

body.description: The HTML body of the announcement

publication_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch) of announcement publication

id.description: A unique identifier for the announcement

important.description: Whether the announcement is marked as important

confirmation.description: Whether the user confirmation is required for this announcement

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request

enabled.description: Value is set to 'true' when user account is locked in currency

message.description: Optional information for user why his account is locked

id.description: The id that was sent in the request

ip.description: IP address of source that generated action

country.description: Country where the IP address is registered (estimated)

city.description: City where the IP address is registered (estimated)

log.description: Action description, values: `changed_email` - email was changed; `changed_password` - password was changed; `disabled_tfa` - TFA was disabled; `enabled_tfa` - TFA was enabled, `success` - successful login; `failure` - login failure; `enabled_subaccount_login` - login was enabled for subaccount (in `data` - subaccount uid); `disabled_subaccount_login` - login was disabled for subbaccount (in `data` - subbacount uid);`new_api_key` - API key was created (in `data` key client id); `removed_api_key` - API key was removed (in `data` key client id); `changed_scope` - scope of API key was changed (in `data` key client id); `changed_whitelist` - whitelist of API key was edited (in `data` key client id); `disabled_api_key` - API key was disabled (in `data` key client id); `enabled_api_key` - API key was enabled (in `data` key client id); `reset_api_key` - API key was reset (in `data` key client id)

data.description: Optional, additional information about action, type depends on `log` value

average_price.description: Average price of trades that built this position

mark_price.description: Current mark price for position's instrument

settlement_price.description: Optional (not added for spot). Last settlement price for position's instrument 0 if instrument wasn't settled yet

size.description: Position size for futures size in quote currency (e.g. USD), for options size is in base currency (e.g. BTC)

size_currency.description: Only for futures, position size in base currency

average_price_usd.description: Only for options, average price in USD

floating_profit_loss_usd.description: Only for options, floating profit or loss in USD

leverage.description: Current available leverage for future position

realized_funding.description: Realized Funding in current session included in session realized profit or loss, only for positions of perpetual instruments

projected_initial_margin.description: Projected initial margin. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

projected_delta_total.description: The sum of position deltas without positions that will expire during closest expiration

cashflow.description: For futures and perpetual contracts: Realized session PNL (since last settlement). For options: the amount paid or received for the options traded.

change.description: Change in cash balance. For trades: fees and options premium paid/received. For settlement: Futures session PNL and perpetual session funding.

info.description: Additional information regarding transaction. Strongly dependent on the log entry type

equity.description: Updated equity value after the transaction

settlement_price.description: The settlement price for the instrument during the delivery

index_price.description: The index price for the instrument during the delivery

position.description: Updated position size after the transaction

side.description: One of: `short` or `long` in case of settlements, `close sell` or `close buy` in case of deliveries, `open sell`, `open buy`, `close sell`, `close buy` in case of trades

amount.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

price.description: Settlement/delivery price or the price level of the traded contracts

price_currency.description: Currency symbol associated with the `price` field value

profit_as_cashflow.description: Indicator informing whether the cashflow is waiting for settlement or not

interest_pl.description: Actual funding rate of trades and settlements on perpetual instruments

block_rfq_id.description: ID of the Block RFQ - when trade was part of the Block RFQ

ip.description: The IP address from which the trade was initiated

additional_reserve.description: The account's balance reserved in other orders

fee_balance.description: The account's fee balance (it can be used to pay for fees)

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for broken references

continuation_with_null.description: Continuation token for pagination. `NULL` when no continuation.

estimated_liquidation_price.description: Estimated liquidation price, added only for futures, for users with `segregated_sm` margin model

estimated_liquidation_ratio.description: Estimated Liquidation Ratio is returned only for users without portfolio margining enabled. Multiplying it by future position's market price returns its estimated liquidation price. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

is_rebalance.description: Optional (only for spot). `true` if order was automatically created during cross-collateral balance restoration

is_liquidation.description: Optional (not added for spot). `true` if order was automatically created during liquidation

mmp.description: `true` if the order is a MMP order, otherwise `false`.

risk_reducing.description: `true` if the order is marked by the platform as a risk reducing order (can apply only to orders placed by PM users), otherwise `false`.

replaced.description: `true` if the order was edited (by user or - in case of advanced options orders - by pricing engine), otherwise `false`.

auto_replaced.description: Options, advanced orders only - `true` if last modification of the order was performed by the pricing engine, otherwise `false`.

quote.description: If order is a quote. Present only if true.

mmp_group.description: Name of the MMP group supplied in the `private/mass_quote` request. Only present for quote orders.

quote_set_id.description: Identifier of the QuoteSet supplied in the `private/mass_quote` request. Only present for quote orders.

quote_id.description: The same QuoteID as supplied in the `private/mass_quote` request. Only present for quote orders.

trigger_order_id.description: Id of the trigger order that created the order (Only for orders that were created by triggered orders).

app_name.description: The name of the application that placed the order on behalf of the user (optional).

mmp_cancelled.description: `true` if order was cancelled by mmp trigger (optional)

oto_order_ids.description: The Ids of the orders that will be triggered if the order is filled

primary_order_id.description: ID of the order that triggered this order.

is_primary_otoco.description: `true` if the order is an order that can trigger an OCO pair, otherwise not present.

pending_withdrawal_balance.description: Pending balance transferred from trading account to custody account

auto_deposit.description: When set to 'true' all new funds added to custody balance will be automatically transferred to trading balance

client_id.description: API key 'client id' used to reserve/release funds in custody platform, requires scope 'custody:read_write'

withdrawal_address.description: Address that is used for withdrawals

withdrawal_address_change.description: UNIX timestamp after when new withdrawal address will be used for withdrawals

pending_withdrawal_addres.description: New withdrawal address that will be used after 'withdrawal_address_change'

deposit_address.description: Address that can be used for deposits

ip_whitelist.description: List of IP addresses whitelisted for a selected key

projected_maintenance_margin.description: Projected maintenance margin. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

is_secondary_oto.description: `true` if the order is an order that can be triggered by another order, otherwise not present.

client_secret.description: Client secret or MD5 fingerprint of public key used for authentication

commission.description: Commission paid so far (in base currency)

fee_role.description: Fee role of the user: `maker` or `taker`. Can be different from trade role of the user when iceberg order was involved in matching.

refresh_amount.description: The initial display amount of iceberg order. Iceberg order display amount will be refreshed to that value after match consuming actual display amount. Absent for other types of orders

oco_ref.description: Unique reference that identifies a one_cancels_others (OCO) pair.

api_key_name.description: Api key name that can be displayed in transaction log

public_key.description: PEM encoded public key (Ed25519/RSA) used for asymmetric signatures (optional)

average_price.description: Average fill price of the order

role.description: Trade role of the user: `maker` or `taker`

advanced.description: advanced type: `"usd"` or `"implv"` (Only for options; field is omitted if not applicable).

filled_amount.description: Filled amount of the order. For perpetual and futures the filled_amount is in USD units, for options - in units or corresponding cryptocurrency contracts, e.g., BTC or ETH.

reject_post_only.description: `true` if order has `reject_post_only` flag (field is present only when `post_only` is `true`)

triggered.description: Whether the trigger order has been triggered

cancel_reason.description: Enumerated reason behind cancel `"user_request"`, `"autoliquidation"`, `"cancel_on_disconnect"`, `"risk_mitigation"`, `"pme_risk_reduction"` (portfolio margining risk reduction), `"pme_account_locked"` (portfolio margining account locked per currency), `"position_locked"`, `"mmp_trigger"` (market maker protection), `"mmp_config_curtailment"` (market maker configured quantity decreased), `"edit_post_only_reject"` (cancelled on edit because of `reject_post_only` setting), `"oco_other_closed"` (the oco order linked to this order was closed), `"oto_primary_closed"` (the oto primary order that was going to trigger this order was cancelled), `"settlement"` (closed because of a settlement)

api_key_enabled.description: Informs whether api key is enabled and can be used for authentication

api_key_default.description: Informs whether this api key is default (field is deprecated and will be removed in the future)

currency_amount.description: Amount of funds in given currency

trigger_reference_price.description: The price of the given trigger at the time when the order was placed (Only for trailing trigger orders)

api_key_features.description: List of enabled advanced on-key features. Available options: - `restricted_block_trades`: Limit the block_trade read the scope of the API key to block trades that have been made using this specific API key - `block_trade_approval`: Block trades created using this API key require additional user approval. Methods that use `block_rfq` scope are not affected by Block Trade approval feature

amount.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

id.description: Unique identifier

display_amount.description: The actual display amount of iceberg order. Absent for other types of orders.

trigger_offset.description: The maximum deviation from the price peak beyond which the order will be triggered (Only for trailing trigger orders)

username.description: System name or user defined subaccount alias

trigger_price.description: Trigger price (Only for future trigger orders)

block_trade_order.description: `true` if order made from block_trade trade, added only in that case.

trigger_fill_condition.description: The fill condition of the linked order (Only for linked order types), default: `first_hit`. - `"first_hit"` - any execution of the primary order will fully cancel/place all secondary orders. - `"complete_fill"` - a complete execution (meaning the primary order no longer exists) will cancel/place the secondary orders. - `"incremental"` - any fill of the primary order will cause proportional partial cancellation/placement of the secondary order. The amount that will be subtracted/added to the secondary order will be rounded down to the contract size.

contracts.description: It represents the order size in contract units. (Optional, may be absent in historical data).

trigger.description: Trigger type (only for trigger orders). Allowed values: `"index_price"`, `"mark_price"`, `"last_price"`.

mobile.description: optional field with value `true` added only when created with Mobile Application

reduce_only.description: Optional (not added for spot). '`true` for reduce-only orders only'
